xxl.core.math.statistics.nonparametric.histograms

Class LogScaleHistogram

  • java.lang.Object
    • xxl.core.math.statistics.nonparametric.histograms.LogScaleHistogram

  • public class LogScaleHistogram
extends Object
    This class realizes a histogram based on a logarithm scale. As input data 2-dimensional data is considered. The first dimension is used to map the vector to a certain histogram bucket. The second value represents an aggregate (e.g. sum or average).

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      LogScaleHistogram(double left, double right, int bucketCount, double logFactor)
      Constructs a log scale histogram with a predefined number of buckets.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void process(double d, double value)
      Inserts a tuple into the histogram, i.e., the according bucket is computed and the frequency is updated.
      String toString()
      Returns the gathered statistic.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • LogScaleHistogram

        public LogScaleHistogram(double left,
                         double right,
                         int bucketCount,
                         double logFactor)
        Constructs a log scale histogram with a predefined number of buckets. The interval is [left,right]. logFactor means that interval 0 ( [border[0],border[1]) ) is logFactor smaller than interval 1 ( [border[1],border[2]) ).
        Parameters:
        left - left border
        right - right border
        bucketCount - number of buckets
        logFactor - size factor between two consecutive intervals

    • Method Detail

      • process

        public void process(double d,
                    double value)
        Inserts a tuple into the histogram, i.e., the according bucket is computed and the frequency is updated.
        Parameters:
        d - x-value (decides into which bucket the value falls)
        value - y-value

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Returns the gathered statistic.
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
        Returns:
        String with the data of the histogram
